descriptions.validator: Run SHACL checks with Monaco + TanStack

stats.title: RDF snapshot
stats.subtitle: Detected resources
stats.empty: Paste RDF to surface quick stats here.

command.empty: No matches. Try a different keyword.

home.title: RDF Metadata Validator
home.subtitle: Validate your metadata against standard SHACL profiles (DCAT-AP, DCAT-AP-ES, NTI-RISP) directly in your browser.

validator.placeholder: Paste your RDF content here (Turtle, RDF/XML, JSON-LD)...
validator.corsWarning: Note: Some servers may block requests from the browser (CORS). If validation fails, try downloading the file and pasting the content directly.
validator.urlError: Failed to fetch content from URL. It might be due to CORS restrictions. Try copying the content and pasting it in the "Text Input" tab.
validator.workspaceSubtitle: Paste RDF, fetch from URL, or upload heavy catalogs with progress tracking.

actions.pasteDescription: Write or paste RDF with Monaco and preview transformations.
actions.urlDescription: Probe a remote catalog, inspect metadata and validate in place.
actions.uploadDescription: Drop huge TTL/JSON-LD files with chunked streaming and cancel options.

validator.dropTitle: Drop a TTL / RDF / JSON-LD file
validator.dropSubtitle: Files stay in the browser. Maximize reliability with chunked reads.

results.detailsDescription: Group duplicated findings, pin columns, and export filtered views.

viewer.title: SHACL Report Viewer
viewer.subtitle: Visualize existing SHACL validation reports (Turtle format).
viewer.importDescription: Upload TTL files or paste raw RDF, then unlock analytics and exports.
viewer.error: Failed to parse SHACL report. Ensure it is valid Turtle (TTL) format.
viewer.topShapesHint: Shapes and constraints with the highest number of issues.
viewer.emptyStats: Import a report to unlock severity analytics.
viewer.emptyShapes: Upload a SHACL report to highlight the noisiest shapes.

guide.title: SHACL Guide
guide.description: SHACL (Shapes Constraint Language) is a W3C standard that validates RDF graphs against reusable shapes so data stays aligned with models such as DCAT-AP.

tools.title: Select Your Tool
tools.description: There is no 'best tool'—it depends on your profile and needs. Choose your workflow to see recommendations.

web.title: Web Interfaces
web.description: No installation required. Paste or upload your RDF and get instant results in your browser.

cli.title: Command Line Tools
cli.description: Powerful tools for automation, CI/CD pipelines, and batch processing of large catalogs.

thisApp.title: SHACL Validator (This App)
thisApp.description: Browser-based validation with DCAT-AP profiles, visual reports, and CSV/TTL export. No backend required.

itb.title: ITB SHACL Validator
itb.description: Official EU validator from the Interoperability Test Bed. Supports custom SHACL shapes and multiple output formats.

jena.title: Apache Jena (RIOT/SHACL)
jena.description: The Swiss army knife for RDF in Java. Powerful, robust, and standard in production environments. Requires Java.

pyshacl.title: pySHACL
pyshacl.description: Pure Python library. Easy to install with pip. Ideal if you already work with data scripts in Python.

dockerPyshacl.title: docker-pyshacl
dockerPyshacl.description: Ready-to-use Docker image with pySHACL and DCAT-AP shapes. Perfect for CI/CD and reproducible validations.

rdf.title: RDF
rdf.description: Resource Description Framework: The standard data model for metadata. Catalogs are written as RDF graphs using Turtle, JSON-LD, or RDF/XML.

shacl.title: SHACL
shacl.description: Shapes Constraint Language: A W3C language for validating RDF graphs against reusable shapes. Detects errors and suggestions.

dcatap.title: DCAT-AP
dcatap.description: Data Catalog Vocabulary – Application Profile for European portals. DCAT-AP-ES is the Spanish extension with additional requirements.

steps.selectProfile: Select the Validation Profile you need (for example DCAT-AP-ES).
steps.directInputDescription: Paste RDF content (Turtle, RDF/XML, JSON-LD) directly into the text area.
steps.fromUrlDescription: Provide a link to an RDF file. Keep in mind that some servers can block browser requests because of CORS.
steps.validate: Click Validate to launch the SHACL checks.
steps.review: Review the result table and filter by severity (Violation, Warning, Info).
steps.export: Export the report in Turtle or CSV to share evidence of the validation run.
steps.reports: Use the Reports section to visualize previously exported SHACL reports:
steps.reportsUploadDescription: Drag or select a TTL file of a SHACL report to visualize its results.
steps.reportsVisualizeDescription: Explore charts by severity, identify the most affected shapes, and export specific segments.

violation.title: Violation
violation.description: Blocking issues that must be fixed for the dataset to conform.

warning.title: Warning
warning.description: Important issues that should be addressed even if they might not break conformance depending on the profile.

info.title: Info
info.description: Suggestions or contextual notes that can help improve metadata quality.

decoder.title: Interactive Report Decoder
decoder.description: Click on any highlighted line to see what it means and how to fix related issues.
decoder.placeholder: Click on a line in the report to see its explanation.
decoder.tipContent: Always check sh:focusNode first—it tells you exactly which resource has the problem, then look at sh:resultPath to find the missing or invalid property.

explanations.validationReport: This line declares the resource as a SHACL Validation Report. Every SHACL output starts with this class.
explanations.conformsFalse: The data does NOT conform to the SHACL shapes. There is at least one violation or warning that needs attention.
explanations.validationResult: This block represents a single validation finding—a violation, warning, or informational note.
explanations.severityViolation: This is a VIOLATION: a mandatory constraint is broken. You must fix this before the data can be considered compliant.
explanations.severityWarning: This is a WARNING: a recommended constraint is not met. Fix if possible, but it may not block conformance.
explanations.minCount: The MinCountConstraintComponent means a required property is missing or doesn't have enough values.
explanations.resultMessage: This human-readable message explains what went wrong. Read carefully for hints on how to fix the issue.
explanations.focusNode: The Focus Node is the exact RDF resource where the problem was detected. Use this URI to locate the issue in your data.
explanations.resultPath: The Result Path shows which property is failing (e.g., dcat:dataset). Add or correct this property on the focus node.

glossary.title: SHACL Glossary
glossary.description: Key terms to understand SHACL validation reports.

focusNode.definition: The specific RDF resource (identified by a URI or blank node) where the validator found a problem. Check this node in your data to fix the issue.

shape.definition: A set of constraints that define what valid data looks like. Shapes are written in SHACL and applied to RDF resources.

severity.definition: Indicates how serious a finding is: Violation (error), Warning (recommendation), or Info (suggestion).

target.definition: Specifies which RDF resources a shape applies to—typically all instances of a class (e.g., dcat:Dataset).

conforms.definition: A boolean value indicating whether the data passed all constraints (true) or had at least one violation (false).

constraintComponent.definition: The type of rule that was checked, such as sh:minCount (minimum occurrences), sh:pattern (regex match), or sh:class (type check).

resultPath.definition: The RDF property path where the issue was found. For example, dcat:dataset means the problem is in the dcat:dataset property.

resultMessage.definition: A human-readable explanation of the problem. Read this carefully—it often contains hints about what value is expected.

settings.appearanceDescription: Switch between light and dark tokens for the entire workspace.
settings.themeDescription: Toggle to apply the dark palette across the app shell.
settings.themeNote: Preference is stored locally so deployments stay untouched.
settings.designTokensDescription: Customize CSS variables to adapt typography, spacing, and palettes.

tokens.background: Base surface for cards and shell.
tokens.foreground: Default text color across the UI.
tokens.primary: Primary accent for buttons and highlights.
tokens.accent: Secondary accent used in gradients and chips.
tokens.border: Soft border color for cards and tables.
tokens.radius: Global border radius used by cards and buttons.

zen.label: Zen aqua
zen.description: Soft greens and teals to highlight successful validations.

midnight.label: Midnight
midnight.description: High-contrast dark palette for long review sessions.

citrus.label: Citrus
citrus.description: Warm energetic accents to call out issues quickly.

workspace.title: Workspace tools
workspace.subtitle: Manage the caches that stay in this browser.

history.title: Reset validation history
history.description: Clear sparkline data and statistics stored from recent runs.

theme.title: Reset theme preference
theme.description: Return to the system color scheme and drop the manual toggle.

feedback.theme: Theme preference synced with the system.
